row.AboutMe:
Hi, I'm not really a person.

I'm a background process that helps keep this site clean!

I do things like

  • Randomly poke old unanswered questions every hour so they get some attention
  • Own community questions and answers so nobody gets unnecessary reputation from them
  • Own downvotes on spam/evil posts that get permanently deleted
  • Own suggested edits from anonymous users

Developer on the StackOverflow team. Find me on

Twitter

Stack Overflow Valued Associate #00003

Stack Exchange Valued Associate #00005

I am the Director of Community Development for the Stack Exchange Network.

I can be reached at
rcartaino@stackexchange.com

I've been programming professionally in C#, ASP.NET, Perl, JavaScript and VB6 (!!!) since 2003. Emacs and FireFox are my preferred environments. After that, I like to throw wikis at problems to make them go away. And if they don't go away, at least we've got the page revisions under version control!

You know what they say about bad code? It's anything YOU wrote, or anything I wrote more than 6 weeks ago.

:::sigh:::

I keep trying to add days to that equation....
Born and lives in Croatia. Known to friends as Medo. Likes programming and chevaps. In free time he writes a blog.
I'm a computer science student.
@MikeGrace Programming, web, photography, family, cycling. ; )
Software developer and author of the YAGRAC - Yet Another Goodreads Android Client application.

Currently web (C#/ASP.NET) programmer for a printing business.

Former computer science college student with a strong background in Java and C#.

I'm a moderator on the Android StackExchange. I own a G1 running CM5 and a Motorola Droid running CM6. I also own a rooted Nook Color and a wifi Motorola Xoom. I currently use a rooted Galaxy Nexus as my main device.

You can also find me on Twitter.

I'm also a new Android developer. Check out my tipping calculator app called "Tippy Tipper" or my car dock app called "Car Dashboard" here. The source code for "Tippy Tipper" can be found here.

Enjoys solving problems, technology, software development, food, reading, photography, blogging, and traveling.

I graduated with a Bachelor of Science in Software Engineering from the Rochester Institute of Technology in May 2011. I'm currently employed at UTC Aerospace Systems in Massachusetts as a Software Engineer. My full CV is available on StackOverflow Careers and LinkedIn.

I work at Canonical on the Ubuntu Community Team working on cloud related topics such as juju for the world's #1 Cloud OS, Ubuntu! As part of the community team my standing order is to make Ubuntu a wonderful place to participate, so if we're not making that happen for you let me know!

I try to focus on answering community and juju tagged questions on Ask Ubuntu. Part of my job at Canonical is to help Ubuntu rock for you in the cloud, be it AWS, HP Cloud, Rackspace, Dreamhost, or your own OpenStack. So if you're doing that and we're not being awesome for you then I'm your guy to help fix your problems.

I tend to mingle on other tags and SE sites as well. I like dinosaurs, hockey, tacos, and heavy metal.

  • http://juju.ubuntu.com

Android-wise I was an early adopter, pre-ordering a G1 back in 2007. I had it rooted and running custom ROMs before it was a one-click deal and before NANDRIOD backups were easy to do! It's definitely less scary these days.

I currently have a Desire, rooted and running the latest CyanogenMod ROM since I finally decided I really didn't care enough about HTC Sense to keep waiting for the latest OS versions to be skinned before I could update.

Really not too excited about any of the phones that have come out since the Desire/Nexus One; they're OK but, meh. More interested in seeing the market for Honeycomb based tablets filling up. Not that I'll ever be able to afford one :o/

Shawn Wildermuth is an eight-time Microsoft MVP (Data), member of the INETA Speaker's Bureau and an author of six books and dozens of articles on .NET. Shawn is involved with Microsoft as a Silverlight Insider, Data Insider and Connected Technology Advisors (WCF/Oslo/WF). He has been seen speaking at a variety of international conferences including TechEd, Oredev, SDC, VSLive, WinDev, MIX, DevTeach, DevConnections and DevReach. I am essentially an IT "jack of all trades" - I currently work in the education department of a fairly large health system (~5000 employees).

My official title is "Computer-based Training Developer", and my job encompasses:

  • Programming new features for the homebrew CMS I wrote that we use for managing online education, classroom education, and the few hybrid courses we offer

  • UI Design
  • Database Admin. duties
  • Server Admin. duties
  • Testing
  • Tech Support for said system
  • Editorial/Publishing duties for the educational content

While I am not a super-star programmer or a super-star admin; I am a strong, competent worker in just about any job I've tried my hand at.

I also teach some other, non-tech classes - CPR, ACLS, PALS, and Nonviolent Crisis Intervention.

Denny Cherry is an independent consultant with over a decade of experience working with platforms such as Microsoft SQL Server, Hyper-V, vSphere and Enterprise Storage solutions.
